revision.text: ==Asturian== ===Verb=== {{ast-verb}} # To [[move]], [[sway]], [[shake]] ====Conjugation==== {{ast-conj-gar|xirin}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|ast|xiringüelu}} ---- ==Galician== ===Etymology=== From {{m|gl|xiringa|t=syringe}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gl|/ʃiɾiŋˈɡaɾ/}} ===Verb=== {{gl-verb|xiring|ar|pret=xiringuei}} # {{lb|gl|transitive}} to [[inject]] with a [[syringe]] # {{lb|gl|transitive}} to [[splash]] # {{lb|gl|transitive}} to [[squirt]] #: {{syn|gl|cichar}} # {{lb|gl|transitive|figurative}} to [[disturb]], [[bother]], [[harm]] #* '''1813''', anonymous, ''Decima constitucional'': #*: ''bufe o escribano ladrón, que o pelexo me sacou, e breme o que me acabou con trabucos, e liortas: gráceas dan as miñas portas a quen así os xiringou.'' #*:: let him hiss, the thief scribe who took my hide; and let him fret, who finished me with tributes and struggles: thanks are given by my doors to whom that so '''disturbed''' them #* '''c1840''', Ramón Varela Vahamonde, ''Conversa entre os arrieiros'': #*: ''Váian ao inferno a beber,'' #*: ''Que a min ben me '''xiringaron''''' #*: ''E, entre mangas e riostras,'' #*: ''Trecentos reás vöaron.'' #*: ''Débenme, Dios sabe canto,'' #*: ''O menos trint’e set’olas'' #*: ''E coidaban os larpeiros'' #*: ''De pagarmas con parolas.'' #*:: Let them go to Hell to drink, #*:: because they '''harmed''' me very much #*:: and, among other things, #*:: three hundred reals flew away. #*:: They owe me God knows how much, #*:: at least seventy-four gallons, #*:: and the gluttons thought of #*:: paying me with banter. #: {{syn|gl|amolar|enfastidiar}} ====Conjugation==== {{gl-conj-car|xiring|xiringu}} ===References=== * {{R:gl:DDLG}} * {{R:gl:TILG}} * {{R:TLPGP}} <references/>
